Summary
com. mab. ui. accordion. AccordionMenuItem
** Description Here...
Variables
menuController
A reference to the associated AccordionController
oContentArea
The content area that will be collasped on the accordion menu item
oContentMask
The mask for the content area
oMenuTitle
The ‘header’ button that will open/close the menu title.
initialY
The initial position of the holder, used for position in shiftBy
Functions
AccordionMenuItem
If oContentMask is not set, it will create one and setMask() on oContentArea.
open
Opens the content mask for the menu item
close
Closes the content mark for the menu item
shiftBy
Shifts the whole movieclip down by a specified amount
initMenuItem
Sets the initial Y position and the target & action for the button.
Properties
contentHeight
contentWidth

Variables

menuController

public var menuController: AccordionController

A reference to the associated AccordionController

oContentArea

private var oContentArea

The content area that will be collasped on the accordion menu item

oContentMask

private var oContentMask

The mask for the content area

oMenuTitle

private var oMenuTitle

The ‘header’ button that will open/close the menu title.  AccordionController expects this to be a <basicButton>, but you can subclass AccordionController to change this functionality

initialY

private var initialY: Number

The initial position of the holder, used for position in shiftBy

Functions

AccordionMenuItem

function AccordionMenuItem()

If oContentMask is not set, it will create one and setMask() on oContentArea.  If you want to set a custom oContentMask oContentMask.removeMovieClip() and do your custom stuff in a subclass or place one in the MC before its initialized

open

public function open() : Void

Opens the content mask for the menu item

close

public function close() : Void

Closes the content mark for the menu item

shiftBy

public function shiftBy(dY: Number) : Void

Shifts the whole movieclip down by a specified amount

Arguments

dY[Number] amount to shift the _y of the menu item by

initMenuItem

public function initMenuItem() : Void

Sets the initial Y position and the target & action for the button.  Overide in subclass if your not using basicButton for the oMenuTitle or want to do something fancy

Properties

contentHeight

function get contentHeight() : Number

contentWidth

function get contentWidth() : Number
